markings: Wax seal with impression on verso: Vente Meissonier 1893

texts.remarks: not vetted - notes suggest more info is in file.

texts.textentryhtml: A history painter, portraitist, and sculptor, Meissonier had particular success with military scenes, thanks to a meticulous realism. In addition to Napoleonic battles, he painted scenes from his own time, such as this sentry from a light infantry regiment (voltigeur) and two of his fellows on guard duty beneath a gray sky. An engraving of this scene attests to its appeal to audiences of the time.
